page.title: 12Village of Bradford Peverell
page.content: }Bradford Peverell is a thriving new village to the North-West of Dorchester with a mixture of old and new houses. Its population in 1983 was 359. The surronding area is hilly and rural with two main farms Manor and Gascoyne. They are arable and dairy land. Many people who live in Bradford Peverell work in Dorchester, but many years ago it was a farming village. A number of buildings have been converted into living houses. These include the old village Post Office and School house. The old village tree was felled but the villagers decided to plant another one next to the village hall.St. Mary's was first sited in 1289.
